reviewText: This is my first Tamilee Webb DVD, and I have to say, I really like this one.  I have Denise Austin and the Crunch Pilates DVDs that I love and use regularly, but this one I'm sure to use daily.  It's just so easy, and Tamilee is encouraging without being annoying, which I can't stand.The DVD itself is very barebones, just Tamilee on a set with a mat, some weights, and some plants on the background.  There's not jumping around, and all you need are a mat, or your carpet, and some 2, 5, or 10 pound weights.  I'd guess that if you're a beginner, you could do this DVD for a long time, and if you're more advanced you'll get plenty of use by increasing the amount of weight you use.Tamilee gives excellent instruction, and is very careful to educate you on proper form and the muscles being used.  There's little room for boredom because once you begin to get used to one exercise Tamilee moves on to the next.I'd recommend this video, esp. for those who bore easily, and want to tone up without hours lifting everyday.  I do three segments, but you can easily do more or less depending on your schedule.

reviewText: Does a lot in a short amount of time. I was very pleased with it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I really enjoy the abs & arms part of this DVD.  As someone else said, if you're looking for a major ab workout, this isn't for you.  She focuses more on the arms than the abs.  The ab workouts are good, there just aren't as much as I expected when I bought this.  I also like her fitness tips she gives when she's working out.  It's nice to hear how knowledgable she is.  I like to use these workouts as a warm-up to my cardio.  However, I'm not crazy about her leg workouts.  I don't care for the sliding exercises she does and I just don't feel like they work for me.  I find they are too easy and I get bored doing them.  It may be better for a beginner.  The arm and segments definitely make this worth buying though.
summary: Decent workout - esp. when short on time

reviewText: This review refers to the ARMS/ABS sections (I haven't done the other part yet)This is definitely not enough of a workout on it's own.  You'll either need to do several segments in a row or add a segment to another workout you do.  The only problem is that each of the arm segments starts with a ~min "warmup"(marching in place, step side & stretching), so if you really are doing other workouts, the "warmup" is a waste of time trying to fwd past it to get to the main part of the workout.In the arms video DURING the main workout you're forced to listen to her annoying lecture about fattiness and body types.  She definitely looses stars for this.ARMS/Abs 1 1 (this is a good, no frills video on basic weighlifting exercises using handweights.  The instructor gives clear cues and has decent form.  If you are looking for similar but either more advanced or a different variety of moves, I would recommend the videos from The Firm series available at FirmDirect or Amazon -- I prefer the older firm videos that don't use the fancy box/step.)1st 4min is the copyright warning & warmup/stretchingbicep curl, lat row, tricep kickback & overhead extention, lateral delt flies.Crunch & pelvic tilt combo, Oblique twists.ARMS/Abs 24min warmup/stretchingbicep curls, french press, diagonal lift & overhead pressupper crunch, lower ab contraction, crunch+oblique comboARMS/Abs 3Warmup/stretchTricept kickback + bicep curls.  Overhead press. Flies. Bicep curls.Upper & lower crunches with legs straight up.  Oblique twist.  Crunch with legs extended.BUNSINNER/OUTER THIGHTSHIPS, THIGHS, CALVES
summary: Simple no-nonsense program -- recommended for beginners  (but not intense enough for intermed-adv)

reviewText: This DVD has two parts broken down into three workouts each.  Each individual workout has warm-up, stretch, exercise, and stretch.  If you don't have a lot of time, or are not very motivated, a 15 min segment would probably fit your needs well.  I combined the three arms and ab segments into a single workout and the three lower body into a single work out.  I added ankle weights to the lower body segments.  I got a GREAT workout and post-workout burn.  Tamilee is a great motivator and she explains things VERY well.
Title: N/A
